alert.note: Alert for Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 1:56PM CDT until May 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, Cook and Lake. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 PM CDT Friday, gauge reports indicated elevated stream flows due to snow melt. Minor flooding is expected to begin this weekend in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area through the weekend. The heaviest precipitation is expected between 7PM Saturday and 7AM Sunday. Visitors exploring area rivers for waterfall viewing or water recreation should use caution along waterways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tettegouche State Park, Little Marais, George Crosby Manitou State Park, Temperance River State Park, Lutsen, Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Finland, Cascade River State Park, Grand Marais, Judge C.R. Magney State Park, and Grand Portage. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Keep children and pets close and under control. Strong river currents can sweep children away. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Hikers should avoid flooded trail crossings.
